summary: We report in this Q&A on gaps in federal data for the U.S. territories (American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands). At each agency we reviewed, a majority of statistical reports excluded at least one of the territories. Data gaps can limit the government's understanding of territory needs and how to best...
title: U.S. Territories: Coordinated Federal Approach Needed to Better Address Data Gaps
